name: Veggie Bao(Chinese steamed buns)
description: This veggie bao recipe makes for a tasty and fun appetiser.  Vegan recipe
recipeIngredient: 2 teaspoons quick rise or active yeast (quick rise works better)
2 cups asian vegetables (chopped carrots, water chestnuts, broccoli, peas)
2 tablespoons stir-fry sauce or hoisin or sweet and sour sauce

itemListElement.text: In a wok, heat the oil and add chopped onion and serano pepper to it.
itemListElement.name: In a wok, heat the oil and add chopped onion and serano pepper to it.

itemListElement.text: Cook onion on high heat for 5 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Cook onion on high heat for 5 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Add green bell pepper and ginger and keep stirring. Cook on high heat for 3 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Add green bell pepper and ginger and keep stirring. Cook on high heat for 3 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Add the asian vegetables and cook on high heat for 5 minutes. Stir intermittently. I used frozen Asian veggies, so I microwaved them to get them to almost room temperature before adding them to the wok.
itemListElement.name: Add the asian vegetables and cook on high heat for 5 minutes. Stir intermittently. I used frozen Asian veggies, so I microwaved them to get them to almost room temperature before adding them to the wok.

itemListElement.text: Add in the stir fry sauce and sugar and keep stirring.
itemListElement.name: Add in the stir fry sauce and sugar and keep stirring.

itemListElement.text: Cook on high heat for another 2 minutes with constant stirring.
itemListElement.name: Cook on high heat for another 2 minutes with constant stirring.

itemListElement.text: Take off heat and let cool.
itemListElement.name: Take off heat and let cool.

itemListElement.text: Warm the water to about a 110 degrees F(warm to touch) and add yeast and 1 teaspoon sugar to it. Mix well and let sit for 10 minutes or until frothy.
itemListElement.name: Warm the water to about a 110 degrees F(warm to touch) and add yeast and 1 teaspoon sugar to it. Mix well and let sit for 10 minutes or until frothy.

itemListElement.text: Add in the rest of the sugar, oil and 1 cup flour and mix well.
itemListElement.name: Add in the rest of the sugar, oil and 1 cup flour and mix well.

itemListElement.text: Add 1 cup flour at a time and knead into a soft dough.
itemListElement.name: Add 1 cup flour at a time and knead into a soft dough.

itemListElement.text: Place dough in a well oiled and covered container for an hour or until doubled.
itemListElement.name: Place dough in a well oiled and covered container for an hour or until doubled.

itemListElement.text: Knead dough on a well floured surface and divide into small balls. I ended up with 10 balls.
itemListElement.name: Knead dough on a well floured surface and divide into small balls. I ended up with 10 balls.

itemListElement.text: Roll each ball to form a rough circle with thick middle and thin edges.
itemListElement.name: Roll each ball to form a rough circle with thick middle and thin edges.

itemListElement.text: Drop some filling in the middle and gather the dough on top to enclose the filling and pinch the edges close.
itemListElement.name: Drop some filling in the middle and gather the dough on top to enclose the filling and pinch the edges close.

itemListElement.text: Place the buns on a well oiled steamer plate or bamboo steamer lined with parchment paper. I used an idli steamer, used to steam indian rice dumplings.
itemListElement.name: Place the buns on a well oiled steamer plate or bamboo steamer lined with parchment paper. I used an idli steamer, used to steam indian rice dumplings.

itemListElement.text: Steam buns in boiling water for 10-12 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Steam buns in boiling water for 10-12 minutes.
